TopicTitle: Forums to be down for 2 days for upgrade.

Articles.Content:
Ahhhh! I'll be a gibbering mess in the corner of the room, hugging my computer for support...cooing gently.."It will be back soon, it will be better soon, is it back yet? Soon, soon, now? Soon, it will be better, soon, soon.

Posted by Rowsdower...

"Hi, everyone.

On Thursday, May 22nd, we will be upgrading the forum to a new version of vBulletin. In order to complete the upgrade, a downtime of at least 48 hours will be necessary. We're sorry for the inconvenience, but there will be no way to time warp through this, either. Upon the forum's return, you'll find a sleeker look and a lot of changes under the hood that will make for a much improved experience for all.

Thanks! "

Seriously though, I am looking forward to an improved forum. Maybe search will return less random results? Hope, Hope?

'Splosions are the sprinkles on your ice cream sundae....Jeb

Well, there's always the IRC chat where you can 'hang' with other KSP players

http://webchat.esper.net/?nick=&channels=#kspofficial&fg_color=000000&fg_sec_color=000e63&bg_color=ffffff
So, planned downtime? Good luck! Don't pull an April Kraken on us again, would ya?

Ahhhh! I'll be a gibbering mess in the corner of the room, hugging my computer for support...cooing gently.."It will be back soon, it will be better soon, is it back yet? Soon, soon, now? Soon, it will be better, soon, soon.

If that is a real situation.. You might take it as a sign. Go outside a little bit more
Kasper, I demand to know if the search will be better! Tell me your secreeeeetssssssss!
If only there were something to do related to KSP that didn't involve the forums.
At least this wasn't planned for April! *shudder*
Hopefully, it won't be down for over a week like what happened the last time there was an upgrade when unexpected problems showed up during the conversion process.

Kasper, I demand to know if the search will be better! Tell me your secreeeeetssssssss!

Ehhh, perhaps. Haven't really looked into the details of vBulletin's search engines

Hopefully, it won't be down for over a week like what happened the last time there was an upgrade when unexpected problems showed up during the conversion process.

No unexpected problems are expected (heh)
Will we have to re-register on the forum?
No, it's an update, so all data will be kept

Should have been done today.....I won't be home for much of the evening. Go go Godzilla!

An update to the search engine will be a welcomed thing, the one now seems to give me the posts no matter what I put in to search.
Hopefully attachments will work after the upgrade.

This is to move to Curse, right?

(I keed,I keed)

Hopefully attachments will work after the upgrade.

I don't believe we'll be enabling attachments, for obvious security, storage and bandwidth reasons

This is to move to Curse, right?

(I keed,I keed)

Oh, you...

---

Edit: by the way, if any of you have been thinking of joining the forum moderation team (and are over 18 years of age), send a PM to Rowsdower!

Edited May 15, 2014 by KasperVld

No, it's an update, so all data will be kept

Fingers crossed.

This is to move to Curse, right?

(I keed,I keed)

If this Was I would probably Quit.

NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO

That was my thought when I saw the news.

It's like....

I love this forum, 2 days without it will make me go mad.

Not again! I'll be mad if a single post disappears!

Edited May 16, 2014 by The Jedi Master

Edit: by the way, if any of you have been thinking of joining the forum moderation team (and are over 18 years of age), send a PM to Rowsdower!

Darn. I've actually been thinking about this a lot lately, because multiple times i've shown up at a thread with a continuing argument, and put an end to it with simple kind words. Actually once i managed to kill a thread entirely just because nobody knew what to say. there are other instances, but i wont go on about them. but i'm only 16. :/ maybe in two years, you guys will still accept a new moderator.

So I did a quick search and found 3 irrelevant mentions, so I figured this might be a good place to ask the staff:

Has the Heartbleed bug ever been a threat to this site, and if so, has it been fixed?

If not, this temporary shutdown might be a perfect chance to look into fixing it.

And if it's already been fixed/was never a problem and I didn't know...

Well, feel free to disregard this post.

But as far as I'm aware, no dev's ever said anything about the bug.

So I did a quick search and found 3 irrelevant mentions, so I figured this might be a good place to ask the staff:

Has the Heartbleed bug ever been a threat to this site, and if so, has it been fixed?

If not, this temporary shutdown might be a perfect chance to look into fixing it.

And if it's already been fixed/was never a problem and I didn't know...

Well, feel free to disregard this post.

But as far as I'm aware, no dev's ever said anything about the bug.

Considering that the forums don't have an SSL endpoint (there's no https:// version of it) the answer is no. As for other SQUAD "things" I don't know.

EDIT: As with all things security, you should change your passwords often (use a password manager) and never share passwords between sites (again password manager helps).

Edited May 16, 2014 by MentalPower
Web hygiene

It was never a problem. The only part of the site that uses SSL is the Store and it didn't use OpenSSL
